stories.text:
It keeps happening all day today, I thought they'd forbade any product changes?

Perhaps they couldn't resist the urge to scoop up another bucket of users?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Twitter now demanding registration to view a tweet?
A URL Shortner That Respects Privacy
We Kept Datadog from Blowing Up Our AWS Bill
Twitter CEO tells employees no layoffs planned ‘at this time’ following buyout

stories.text:
Why or why not?

I've heard about people changing their own title to be more descriptive but it always felt dishonest to me. Especially when the title reflects some kind of progression (e.g. a data analyst changing their titles to data scientist because it will help them land a better job in the future).

My personal policy has been to always use the exact title the company uses, and then list responsibilities in the bullet points which hopefully explains any potential discrepancy between title and responsibilities.

Thoughts?
stories.title: Ask HN: On your CV do you use a different title from the one your employer uses?
